alert.note: Alert for Clark (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 4:58AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Kiowa, west central Barber, Comanche and southeastern Clark Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 458 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Buttermilk around 515 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Coldwater, Lake Coldwater, Wilmore and Belvidere. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
